affiliations.job_title: Assay development and Screening Scientist, PhD

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmavn","text":"This protocol details the fluorescence assay for Enterovirus D68 (EV-D68) 3C protease activity measurement. This method is intended to measure the activity of viral proteases by using a specific labelled-peptide that allows the detection of the cleaved product. The substrate contains the cleavage-sequence specific to the tested protease and is labeled in C-terminal by the fluorophore Edans (ex 336 nm; em: 455 nm) and in N-ternimal by the quencher Dabcyl (ex 472 nm). In the case of a non-cleaved substrate, the proximity of Dabcyl to Edans prevents the emission and the detection of the fluorescence at 455 nm. The cleavage of the peptide by the protease allows Edans’ fluorescence emission and detection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70s7","text":"Add  of 2x protein   solution to each well containing the compounds to be tested previously dispensed onto the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"btfll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb672","text":"Incubate the mix for   at   and initiate the enzymatic reaction by the addition of   of 2x ( ) substrate solution using the plate reader injector.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8eb7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

The substrate contains the cleavage-sequence specific to the tested protease and is labeled in C-terminal by the fluorophore Edans (ex 336 nm; em: 455 nm) and in N-ternimal by the quencher Dabcyl (ex 472 nm). In the case of a non-cleaved substrate, the proximity of Dabcyl to Edans prevents the emission and the detection of the fluorescence at 455 nm. The cleavage of the peptide by the protease allows Edans’ fluorescence emission and detection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3al3k","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7a2l9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"spectral","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"98AED3BE031711EF953C0A58A9FEAC02","height":314,"is_video":false,"link":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screenshot 2024-04-25 162114.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qekdb8ux7.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qekcb8ux7.png","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkofi","text":"Assay buffer:  Tris pH 7.0,   NaCl,   glycerol and   TCEP (optional).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dq08q","text":"Incubation:   at  .
EV-D68 3C: protein stocks were stored at -80C and used as 2x solution (  ,   final assay concentration) in assay buffer.
Substrate: Dabcyl-KEALFQGPPQFE-Edans (LifeTein, USA) prepared as a stock solution at  in DMSO and used at 2  solution ( ,   final concentration assay concentration) in assay buffer.
Plates: Non-binding, black 384-plate, small volume Greiner for the assay. Non-binding, 96-well polypropylene plates for the serial dilutions of the protease and substrate.
Plate reader: Pherastar FS, BMG Labtech (Germany), 350-460 FI optic module, the plate is read every 30 seconds for 2 hours and shacked 5 s before each {"blocks":[{"key":"4u0en","text":"This step aims to minimize the amount of costly reagents used for the assay and to find the best protease/substrate ratio allowing a high robustness determined by Z' calculation.  A serial dilution of the protease is added to a substrate serial dilution and monitored for fluorescence intensity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4pivf","text":"Prepare a serial dilution of the substrate starting from a solution of    ,  , by transferring in cascade   to the next well containing the same amount of buffer. Transfer 10uL of the 2x solution onto the protease solution by repeat-pipetting from the bottom to the top of the plate. Transfer 10uL of 2x solution onto 384 well plate by repeat-pipetting, from the left to the right to cover several columns of the plate. {"blocks":[{"key":"d02dt","text":"Plot the fluorescent intensity as a function of time for each substrate concentration and determine a reaction time for the analysis which shows a complete (or almost complete) reaction. In the example below, the reaction time for the analysis is set to 120 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbuni","text":"Calculate the mean (μ) and the standard deviation (σ) of fluorescence intensity and then calculate the signal-to-background ratio and the Z' or Zfactor. (s: signal; c: control).
